ReviewList.Text: Physics is not all about deriving and using the formulas.  The only way you will grasp physics is in a conceptual format.  he 1st 1/2 of this book is not helpful at all.  They have pages and pages on how to derive the formula w/out explaining the conceptual part.  Unless your professor specifically asks for the problems in this book, I wouldn't buy it.  You can find all the formulas on the net and how to solve them.

This is the first time I've taken Physics and this book does not have good examples of how to solve problems. I had to hire a tutor and watch video's on the net about solving Physics problems to supplement the lack of explanation in this book. I wish I didn't have to use this book for my Physics class but it's required. I've learned much more off the you tube physics help video's than this book. I'm studying architecture and get all A's in every class. I consider myself smart but this book makes me feel dumb because it's so difficult to grasp the concepts. Don't like this book AT ALL. Would not recommend it. Waste of money!

I ordered this book for my summer Physics class. I requested 2 day shipping, but the book came in 3 business days. I think there may have been an issue with the time at which I ordered the book and then the weekend in between. The book came in good condition, as described, and has been helpful for my studies.

My professor only chose this book for MasteringPhysics assignment. This book is a total joke since the author does not know how to write a book. Only provides the simplest examples. Hate this textbook.
I received this book in a timely manner; however, the book was broken at the spine. You could see where someone tried to hot glue it back but it didn't work. But all in all the book was still usable.
easy to read hard to get a good understanding of the concepts. then again i am not a huge physics fan and i suck at math SOOO if you need a book for class then its a good buy. i still own it
The book is good, I read a couple chapter, but I still hate physics. The book got to my place pretty fast. I sold it back for a very good price at school.
My book was/is in pretty bad condition when I got it. Once I got to chapter 15 I noticed I'm actually missing about 10 pages and others are falling out.
Good intro physics book, problems are clear and concise.

I thought I was getting an awesome deal. Half the price the bookstore was offering. Turns out this one is only half the book also it did not come with the online access key although it was a new book. So, to do my homework I had to pay around $40.00 in addition to the purchase price. I would have come out way better buying this one from the book store. Also, the book is not a hard cover, it is a paperback.

The publisher apparently labels this book as "hardcover," but it's not. It's a paperback book. I called Amazon when I received the book to tell them I received the wrong book, and when they sent me a new one is was exactly the same. Just keep that in mind when you are deciding whether to buy it new or used!
The book has perfect condition and has no highlights in  it. And the book has helped me learn college physics.
Besides a couple bends on the pages, the book was basically new. Wish the book came in a more sturdier box.
